title: Game State Entities Section
description: Defines the structure for the 'entities' array within the gameState section of a save file. This array holds all runtime entity instances and their current states. Entity definitions (templates) are stored in DataRegistry; this captures their runtime instances.

entities.description: An array containing all active runtime entity instances in the game at the time of saving. Each element represents a single entity instance with its unique ID, definition reference, and the current state of its components.

runtimeEntityInstance.title: Runtime Entity Instance
runtimeEntityInstance.description: Defines the structure for persisting a single runtime entity instance. This includes its unique instance identifier, a reference to its base definition, and the current state of all its attached components.

instanceId.description: A persistent, globally unique identifier for this specific entity instance (e.g., a UUID v4). This ID is generated at runtime when the entity instance is created and is used to track the instance across save/load cycles. It MUST be distinct from the definitionId.

definitionId.description: The namespaced ID of the entity definition (e.g., 'isekai:hero_character', 'core:chest') from which this instance was originally created. This ID links the instance back to its static template stored in DataRegistry and MUST conform to the common.schema.json#/definitions/namespacedId format.

components.description: A collection of components currently attached to this entity instance at the time of saving. Keys are namespaced component definition IDs (e.g., 'core:position', 'isekai:mana'), conforming to common.schema.json#/definitions/namespacedId. Values contain the full runtime data for that specific component instance as it exists on this entity. This data reflects any changes from the component's default state in its definition. This collection only includes components currently attached to the instance; components can be dynamically added to an entity instance during gameplay (and would be saved here if attached), and components present in the original definition might have been dynamically removed (and thus would not be present here). The data structure for component values must be serializable (e.g., composed of primitive types, nested objects, and arrays) and should align with the dataSchema defined in its corresponding component definition.

propertyNames.description: Component keys must be valid namespaced IDs referencing the component type, conforming to common.schema.json#/definitions/namespacedId.

additionalProperties.description: The runtime data for a component instance. This can be an object, an array, or a primitive type, depending on the component's 'dataSchema'. Its specific structure is validated at runtime against the 'dataSchema' of the corresponding component definition.
